mainObjective: Investigate the escalating bandit attacks on the Rangers' Outpost and stop the sorcerer who is corrupting the northern wilderness.

plotPoints.title: Desperate Defense
plotPoints.description: The party arrives at Rangers' Outpost to find it in crisis. Three caravans have been massacred in five days with unnatural precision. Ranger Elen, the outpost's commander, recruits the party. Her prime lead is the captured Bandit Leader, Rusk, a man now terrified of his new master. The party must interrogate Rusk to learn the location of the main bandit camp and the identity of the sorcerer, Malarok, who now commands them.
plotPoints.plotImpact: Success provides the location of the main bandit camp in the Thornwood and a name for the villain: Malarok.

sideQuests.title: Restore the Silver Bell Network
sideQuests.description: The outpost's three silver bell towers, a magical long-range communication system, have been sabotaged by Malarok's agents. The North Tower's bell clapper was stolen. The East Tower is overgrown with magically enhanced, thorny vines. The West Tower's harmonic crystal has been shattered.
sideQuests.plotImpact: Restored bells allow the Rangers to send for reinforcements (arriving after the main plot) and provide the party with a one-time 'Early Warning' ability, letting them avoid a planned ambush in the Thornwood.

sideQuests.title: Merchant's Dilemma
sideQuests.description: Trader Sila, the outpost's primary goods supplier, is packing to leave. Her cart of rare alchemical supplies was stolen in a raid. She asks the party to retrieve a specific iron-banded chest from a small bandit cache a few miles away. If they succeed, she'll stay.
sideQuests.plotImpact: Sila remains at the outpost, offering the party a permanent 15% discount and a reward of several powerful potions. Her presence boosts morale.

plotPoints.title: Into the Thornwood
plotPoints.description: Following leads from Rusk, the party ventures into the Thornwood Wilds to find the main bandit camp, located in an old, crumbling watchtower. They must overcome unnaturally aggressive wildlife and bandit patrols to reach the camp, rescue any surviving captives, and find clues about Malarok's ultimate goal.
plotPoints.plotImpact: Evidence found in the camp (maps marked with a strange sigil, and a journal detailing rituals offered to a 'dark stone') points towards a location deeper in the woods to the north.

sideQuests.title: The Hermit's Warning
sideQuests.description: The party can find a hidden cabin belonging to Maelo, a hermit who studies the forest's energies. He will only help if the party first cleanses a nearby spring he uses for scrying, which has been tainted by Malarok's magic. He can then perform a ritual to learn more about the threat.
sideQuests.plotImpact: Maelo reveals that Malarok is using a 'Voidstone'—a shard of a fallen star—to amplify his magic and corrupt the land. He warns them that the stone's dark magic is weakened by pure iron and gives them an iron charm that grows cold when near strong corruption.

sideQuests.title: Rescue the Lost
sideQuests.description: The party discovers a cave where Wounded Scout Neris is protecting Merchant Lira from corrupted wolves. Neris has a partially completed map of the bandit camp's patrols. Lira overheard the bandits talking about 'gathering tributes for the master's ritual' at some 'forgotten altar'.
sideQuests.plotImpact: Neris's map allows the party to bypass the watchtower's primary sentries. Lira's information provides a crucial clue about the final location and Malarok's plan.

plotPoints.title: The Corrupted Grove
plotPoints.description: The trail leads north to a blighted part of the forest where the trees are twisted and the air hums with dark energy. The party must navigate this dangerous grove to find the source of the sorcerer's power, following the increasing cold of the iron charm from Maelo.
plotPoints.plotImpact: The party pinpoints the epicenter of the corruption: a set of crumbling, ancient ruins, guarded by Malarok's most powerful minions.

sideQuests.title: The Withered Hart
sideQuests.description: A magnificent, ancient hart, once a guardian of the forest, has been captured and twisted by Malarok's magic, serving as a powerful guard for the ruins. The party can either defeat it in combat or, if they learned about the iron's properties from Maelo, use it to try and break the spell controlling the beast.
sideQuests.plotImpact: Defeating or freeing the Hart breaks a magical ward hiding the entrance to the ruins' inner sanctum. A shard of its purified antler can be fashioned into a charm that grants resistance to necrotic damage for the final confrontation.

plotPoints.title: Confronting the Corruptor
plotPoints.description: Deep within the ruins, the party finds Malarok the Corruptor. He is performing a dark ritual to absorb the power of a large, pulsating Voidstone Shard set upon an altar. He is a formidable spellcaster, protected by elite bodyguards and the stone's foul energy. The party must defeat Malarok and destroy the Voidstone to end his threat.
plotPoints.plotImpact: With Malarok defeated and the Voidstone shattered, the dark energy dissipates. The corruption in the woods recedes, and the bandits under his control scatter in confusion.

plotPoints.title: Frontier Secured
plotPoints.description: With Malarok defeated and his influence broken, the woods begin to calm. The party returns to Rangers' Outpost as heroes. The remaining bandits have scattered or surrendered. Ranger Elen can finally secure the frontier, and news of the party's deeds begins to spread, opening doors to new adventures.
plotPoints.plotImpact: The party is offered a title, a plot of land by the now-grateful frontier council, and a significant monetary reward. The region is stabilized, and new plot hooks emerge.

dmNotes: Malarok is a physical boss. He should be arrogant and monologue about his plans for power. Consider having him magically scry on the party to taunt them from afar, making his presence known before the final fight.
The corruption's effect on wildlife should escalate. In the Thornwood, animals are just more aggressive. In the Corrupted Grove, they have physical mutations (glowing eyes, shadowy limbs, etc.).
If the party has the iron charm from Maelo (SQ003), it can be used to momentarily weaken Malarok or disrupt his spellcasting once during the final fight.
